MajorClaims.MC2: I prefer the project members to work in person rather them by email

Claims.C1: this means help to achieve a good communication
Claims.C2: discussion face to face in a meeting is much better than by emails
Claims.C3: less misunderstanding leads to less conflicts and fights, and enhance the communication amongst the team members
Claims.C4: emails are not convenient for the work but it is better than none
Claims.C5: work in person will be more efficient
Claims.C6: we should realize that in a project, there are numerous coordination works are required, if each opinion is communicated via email, there will be hundreds or thousands of emails there that we know this is not a good experience

Premises.P1: team members may have different views and they need to reach a union opinion efficiently
Premises.P2: An experiment conducted by the Beijing University asked two groups of people to discuss the budget of an activity
Premises.P3: The first group was asked to discuss in person, while the second group was asked to discuss by email
Premises.P4: the 1st group used 30 minutes to reach the agreement on the budget, while it takes 30 hours for the later one
Premises.P5: The similar experiment done by other scientist show the same result that people can reach an agreement quickly if they could talk to each other
Premises.P6: there will be less conflicts or fight amongst the team members
Premises.P7: Writing an email for an informal matter will make that matter looks official
Premises.P8: people who receives the email may feel nervous or maybe feel offended by the words in writing
Premises.P9: their response will not be recorded and they will not misunderstand the informal discussion to an official claim
Premises.P10: if the same words are expressed in talking, the counterparty will feel more relaxed
Premises.P11: work in person can indirectly improve the quality and the efficiency of the project
Premises.P12: sometimes we have to use emails if the team members are not located in the same place
Premises.P13: it is a classroom or campus projects, there is few possibility that the project members are located in different areas
